result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lafayette Barrios Lugo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lafayette Barrios Lugo in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Lafayette Barrios Lugo.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea and Sentencing hearing.  Defense not proceeding with plea and requests final pretrial and jury trial dates be set.  Court sets the deadline of 12/30/2022 for filing of Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine, Witness lists and Change of Plea forms.  Court Orders State to provide crime lab report prior to final pretrial hearing.  Matter adjourned to Br. 9.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services 10-18-2022 Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Lafayette Barrios Lugo in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Lafayette Barrios Lugo.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Pre-Trial conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer/negotiations are pending. Defense requests plea and sentencing date be set. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-14-2022, filed.
Defendant's Motion to Extend Filing Deadline, filed.

Defendant Lafayette Barrios Lugo in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for decision.  State filed response to defendants motion to exclude.  Defense received discovery but not search warrant affidavit.  Case scheduled for pretrial conference.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Court scheduled deadline for State to turnover search warrant affidavit by July 22, 2022, and defense to file plea forms and any motions by september 12, 2022.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Exclude
State's Exhibit #1

Defendant Lafayette Barrios Lugo in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Court in receipt of motion to suppress from the defense. Court set the following filing deadlines. State has until June 21st, 2022, to file a response to the defenses motion. Defense has until July 8th, 2022, to file a reply to the State's response to the motion. Court scheduled a decision hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Decision scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Defense Motion to Exclude Evidence
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-31-2022

Defendant Lafayette Barrios Lugo in court via zoom and  with attorney Jade K Hall.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court set a deadline for State to provide discovery, minus crime lab report to defense by 4/29; if motions are to be filed the deadline to file paperwork and/or any plea paperwork by 5/31; the next court date in Br 17 is for continued pretrial conference to be held in person.  mn  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-13-2022, Filed.

Defendant Lafayette Barrios Lugo in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lafayette Barrios Lugo appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of Milwaukee Police Officer Joshua Hermann.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch *.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-23-2022, filed.

Defendant Lafayette Barrios Lugo in court with Attorney Jade K Hall.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Defense has intake and is unable to remain present for this matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for  a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated February 16, 2022; received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lafayette Barrios Lugo in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lafayette Barrios Lugo in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lafayette Barrios Lugo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
